intro: Lasiarrhenum, commonly known as the silver leaf plant, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often grown as an ornamental plant. Lasiarrhenum thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate to bright indirect light.
